page.description: The Quick Panels Dialog allows you to define a complex Panel layout quickly.

description.p: You can add multiple Panels (Panel Navigators, Panel Cards and Panel Layouts) at once using the Quick Panel Genie. Panels can have an optional header and/or footer. You can also add static text objects and buttons.

Double-click the placeholder listed in the left-hand column to insert it in the Quick Panel editor. For a Panel Card, Panel Layout, or Panel Navigator, you will be prompted to choose whether or not the panel should also be created with a header and/or footer.
Items can be placed inside Panels using *[tabs]* (not spaces) to indicate that an object belongs inside a Panel. Panels can be nested inside Panels, as well as buttons and static text objects.

section.note: Because indentation is used to indicate containership, there is no need to put in 'ending' directives. For example, there is no need for a *[xb:{PanelCard}]* to be followed by a *[xb:{PanelCardEnd}]* directive.

description.p: There are several pre-defined layouts available. To insert a pre-defined layout, click the *[ui:Insert pre-defined layout]* link. The pre-defined Layouts dialog lists the layouts availalbe, including a description of the layout and the code that will be inserted into the Quick Panel editor.

section.title: Quick Panel Placeholders
section.description: Placeholders used to define the panel layout in the Quick Panel Genie are listed below.

item.name: {PanelCard-H}
item.description: Creates a Panel Card with a Header

item.name: {PanelCard-F}
item.description: Creates a Panel Card with a Footer

item.name: {PanelCard-HF}
item.description: Creates a Panel Card with a Header and Footer

item.name: {PanelLayout-H}
item.description: Creates a Panel Layout with a Header

item.name: {PanelLayout-F}
item.description: Creates a Panel Layout with a Footer

item.name: {PanelLayout-HF}
item.description: Creates a Panel Layout with a Header and Footer

item.name: {PanelNavigator-H}
item.description: Creates a Panel Navigator with a Header

item.name: {PanelNavigator-F}
item.description: Creates a Panel Navigator with a Footer

item.name: {PanelNavigator-HF}
item.description: Creates a Panel Navigator with a Header and Footer

item.name: {StaticTextObject}
item.description: Creates a static text object. Use a colon ':' to define the text to be displayed in the text object. EG: *[xb:{StaticTextObject:This is a static text object}]*

item.name: {ButtonObject}
item.description: Creates a button. Use a colon ':' to define the text in the button. EG: *[xb:{ButtonObject:Click Me!}]*

item.name: {Predefined:Splitview}
item.description: Creates a split-view layout with a 'menu' Panel and 'master' Panel wrapped in a Panel Layout. If the window size is large enough, the 'menu' Panel is shown. Otherwise, the 'menu' Panel is docked and a button is shown in a Panel Header for displaying the menu.

item.name: {Predefined:SplitviewWithIcons}
item.description: Creates a split-view layout with a 'menu' Panel and 'master' Panel wrapped in a Panel Layout. Generates the same controls as the {Predefined:Splitview} but uses an icon to show/hide the docked 'menu' Panel.

item.name: {Predefined:SplitviewWithIconsAndPanels}
item.description: Creates a split-view layout with a 'menu' Panel and 'master' Panel wrapped in a Panel Layout. Generates the same controls as the {Predefined:Splitview} but uses an icon to show/hide the docked 'menu' Panel. Icons are included in the menu items and sample Panel Cards for each menu item are also created.

section.note: Predefined placeholders should be inserted without additional placeholders. Any placeholers added alongside a Predefined placeholder will be ignored by the Quick Panel Genie.
